alert.note: Alert for Cowley; Sumner (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 30 at 7:54PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Cowley and southeastern Sumner Counties through 900 PM CDT... At 753 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southwest of South Haven, or 8 miles southeast of Caldwell, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Arkansas City, South Haven, Geuda Springs and Hunnewell. This includes Interstate 35 between Mile Markers 1 and 11. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for south central Kansas.
